required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Characteristics of Neonatal Covid-19 in Turkey
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Epidemiological Characteristics of COVID-19 Infection on Babies of Prenatal COVID-19 Positive Women in Turkey

lead_sponsor.agency: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators aimed to investigate the clinical and epidemiological characteristics of neonates who will be born to Covid-19 positive mothers in Turkey. It is a multicentric prospective cohort study designed and destined only in Turkey. The investigators are planning to admit more than 20 Neonatal Intensive Care Units into the survey; nevertheless, the total number may change according to the prevalence of Covid-19 in neonates.
The investigators will also inquire into vertical transmission by collecting cord blood, placental, and postnatal serum samples to test for Covid-19 PCR and Covid-19 Ig M and IgG values from the neonates.

detailed_description.textblock: The patients will be recruited by a secure database of "Trials Network" with individualized accounts. Plexus Corporation will hold data monitoring and primary analysis.

primary_outcome.description: Vertical transmission will be investigated by obtaining neonatal PCR samples in blood, stool and mother milk as well as Neonatal Covid-19 Ig M and Ig G values

secondary_outcome.description: Hospital span time of the neonates in NICU

biospec_descr.textblock: Nasopharyngeal, endotracheal aspirates of the neonate for Covid-19 Placenta and blood and stool samples of the neonate Milk of the mother

study_pop.textblock: The investigators will try to recruit all the babies that will be born to mothers with Covid-19 disease across Turkey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants born to mothers with Covid-19 infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- If PCR values of mother negative, even though the clinic is preferable for Covid-19, the infant will not be recruited.

overall_official.affiliation: Head of Pediatrics and Neonatology, Associate Professor

facility.name: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Medical School

results_reference.citation: Karimi-Zarchi M, Neamatzadeh H, Dastgheib SA, Abbasi H, Mirjalili SR, Behforouz A, Ferdosian F, Bahrami R. Vertical Transmission of Coronavirus Disease 19 (COVID-19) from Infected Pregnant Mothers to Neonates: A Review. Fetal Pediatr Pathol. 2020 Jun;39(3):246-250. doi: 10.1080/15513815.2020.1747120. Epub 2020 Apr 2. Review.

Mimouni F, Lakshminrusimha S, Pearlman SA, Raju T, Gallagher PG, Mendlovic J. Perinatal aspects on the covid-19 pandemic: a practical resource for perinatal-neonatal specialists. J Perinatol. 2020 May;40(5):820-826. doi: 10.1038/s41372-020-0665-6. Epub 2020 Apr 10. Review.
Liu W, Wang J, Li W, Zhou Z, Liu S, Rong Z. Clinical characteristics of 19 neonates born to mothers with COVID-19. Front Med. 2020 Apr;14(2):193-198. doi: 10.1007/s11684-020-0772-y. Epub 2020 Apr 13.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Recep Tayyip Erdogan University Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor of Pediatrics, Neonatologist, Head of Pediatrics

patient_data.ipd_description: all IPD that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The data will be shared in case of review requests from investigators who have an ORCHID account.
